[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_indices()] [Division by Zero] At line 568, assert checks total_shares > 0, but can this be bypassed if vault.total_shares() returns zero due to race conditions during share burns? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_indices()] [Index Overflow] At line 578, new_reward_index = old + add_index without overflow check - can attacker add massive rewards to overflow u256 and wrap around to zero? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_indices()] [Precision Loss] At lines 574-577, div_with_oracle_price converts reward_amount/total_shares to 18 decimals - can precision loss cause reward funds to be locked forever? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: add_reward_balance()] [Minimum Reward Check] At line 357, minimum_reward_amount calculation uses mul_with_oracle_price(total_shares, 1) - can attacker donate tiny rewards below this threshold to cause assertion failure and DoS? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_buffer()] [Minimum Reward Buffer] At line 513, minimum_reward_amount check exists for buffer updates - can accumulated small buffer amounts bypass this and cause lost rewards? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_indices()] [Index Precision] At line 574, div_with_oracle_price divides reward by shares - if reward_amount < total_shares, does add_index become zero causing reward loss? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: add_reward_balance()] [Reward Amount Conversion] At line 352, to_decimals converts u64 to u256 with extra 9 decimals - can this conversion overflow for large reward amounts? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: claim_reward()] [Reward Amount Reconversion] At line 621-623, from_decimals converts back to u64 - can this underflow or lose precision causing users to lose reward fractions? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_indices()] [Index Addition] At line 578, index addition uses get_mut - can concurrent updates cause race conditions where one index update overwrites another? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_buffer()] [Reward Rate Calculation] At line 498, new_reward = rate * time_delta - can large rate values cause overflow in multiplication before time delta check? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: add_reward_balance()] [Share Supply Manipulation] If attacker manipulates vault.total_shares() to be very small before add_reward_balance at line 356, can they cause minimum_reward_amount check to fail and DoS rewards? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_receipt_reward()] [Receipt Index Update] At lines 657-658, receipt indices are updated from RewardManager indices - can stale indices cause incorrect reward calculations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: claim_reward()] [Balance Sufficiency Check] At line 628, assert checks reward_amount <= balance.value() - can rounding errors cause this to fail even when rewards are legitimately owed? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_indices()] [Zero Add Index] If add_index at line 574 calculates to zero due to small reward_amount, are rewards permanently lost as they don't increase the index? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: add_reward_balance()] [Reward Amounts Tracking] At line 366, reward_amounts is incremented - can this become inconsistent with actual reward_balances in Bag causing accounting mismatch? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_buffer()] [Buffer Amount Deduction] At line 532-533, buffer amount is decremented - can underflow occur if actual_reward_amount exceeds remaining_reward_amount due to calculation errors? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: claim_reward()] [Unclaimed Reward Reset] At line 622, reset_unclaimed_rewards is called - can this reset be exploited to claim rewards multiple times? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_indices()] [Multi-Type Race Condition] When multiple reward types update indices concurrently at lines 578-580, can race conditions cause index corruption? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: add_reward_to_buffer()] [Buffer Amount Update] At lines 398-399, buffer amount is updated - can this cause mismatch with reward_balances in Bag if update_reward_buffer fails later? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_buffer()] [Actual vs Expected Reward] At line 515-519, actual_reward_amount may be less than reward_amount - can this discrepancy accumulate and cause reward shortfalls? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: retrieve_undistributed_reward()] [Amount Decimal Conversion] At line 681, to_decimals converts retrieval amount - can this cause mismatch between withdrawn balance and buffer accounting? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_indices()] [Comment vs Implementation] Comment at lines 564-573 describes precision as '1e18 decimals' but implementation at line 574 - does actual math match documented precision? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: add_reward_balance()] [Minimum Check Edge Case] At line 357, if total_shares equals minimum_reward_amount exactly, does the >= check at line 357 allow zero-impact rewards? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: update_reward_buffer()] [Zero Total Shares] At line 524, total_shares > 0 is checked - if shares become zero during buffer update, are rewards lost or rolled to next period? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/reward_manager.move] [Function: claim_reward()] [Reward Type Mismatch] Can attacker claim rewards for RewardCoinType that doesn't match TypeName in reward_balances Bag at line 625-627, causing type confusion? (High)
